definition: talented field commander (military)
general/commander-in-chief (military)/king (chess piece)/to command/to lead
to desire/to invite/to request
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now

sentences.english: The abilities of a soldier are never known until they have been blooded.
sentences.chinese: 只有經歷過戰火，才知道一個士兵是否是將才。

sentences.english: I quite agree with everything he said just now.
I had an odd sense of deja vu just as you said that.
sentences.chinese: 你將才提到的事，我有一中似曾相似的奇怪幻覺。

sentences.english: I'd really hate to lose him.
He said the bank would close soon and would not open again until Monday.
sentences.chinese: 他說銀行很快就要關門，直到禮拜一將才會開門。

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
arrogant and despotic
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
to die in battle (idiom)
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
fully content with one's achievements (idiom)/complacent
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to evaluate the merit of sth

lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
